sub_title: Program Manager & Impact Broker bij The Hunger Project Nederland
summary: I am constantly looking for meaning in both my personal and professional journey: playing music, writing stories, reading wonderful books, travelling to beautiful places nearby or far away, meeting new people and learn from them. I love the interesting and in-depth talks, and on late summer evenings discover ways to transform the world in a fun and safe place with opportunities for everyone. This is my greatest inspiration during my professional experience in the field of development cooperation to create more equality and fairer opportunities for people everywhere!

projects.title: Right to Grow
projects.description: Getting to zero undernutrition and zero people without access to basic WASH services requires a people-centred and community-led approach, with stronger emphasis on the most vulnerable and difficult to reach. Right2Grow believes that sustainable progress can only be achieved by working with local communities, especially women and other marginalised groups.

Program Manager & Impact Broker bij The Hunger Project Nederland

projects.title: Her Education, Her Right Project (donor: EU)
projects.description: The project aims to increase enrolment, retention and completion rates for vulnerable girls in 10 Community Day Secondary Schools (CDSS) in Malawi by; ensuring girls' safe access to schools, increasing family and community support to girls education, empowering girls to make informed decisions, claim their rights and challenge violence.

projects.title: Starschool Ghana and Malawi
projects.description: The starschool programmes in Malawi and Ghana are based on the principles of the programmatic approach. I have brought partner organisations together to work in a coalition towards a common goal: to tackle issues of poor quality of education effectively by creating added value and coherence.

contributors.headline: Program Manager & Impact Broker bij The Hunger Project Nederland

projects.title: Empowering Young People (donor: DFID)
projects.description:
Malawi heeft Youth Friendly Health Services (YFHS) opgezet om HIV/aids, vroege zwangerschappen en schooluitval te voorkomen. Een prachtig initiatief, maar helaas zijn er maar weinig jongeren die gebruik maken van de diensten van de centra. Onderzoek laat zien dat slechts een derde van de jongeren van de YFHS heeft gehoord en maar 13% ervan gebruik maakt. Edukans wil hier verandering in brengen! Leren over al deze thema’s heeft een positieve effect op de scholing en daarmee de toekomst van jongeren.

In samenwerking met partner Yoneco willen we zorgen dat 1.800 jongeren tussen de 10 en 15 jaar op school seksuele vorming krijgen. En de jongeren moeten weten dat ze bij YFHS terecht kunnen voor aanvullende informatie. Een deel van deze jongeren gaat als voorlichter in gesprek met jongeren die niet meer naar school over deze onderwerpen. Op die manier willen we nog eens 3.600 jongeren bereiken.

Leraren van 12 scholen worden getraind in seksuele vorming en 40 medewerkers van de gezondheidscentra in Chikwawa en Mangochi worden opgeleid om de jongeren vriendelijk te benaderen, zodat zij zich thuis voelen in de centra en durven te vertellen wat ze bezig houdt.

Om de gemeenschap te betrekken worden theaterstukken gemaakt over thema’s als HIV/aids en tienerzwangerschappen. Deze voorstelling worden in het openbaar opgevoerd, zodat het hele dorp de kans krijgt om te kijken.

contributors.headline: Program Manager & Impact Broker bij The Hunger Project Nederland

projects.title: Unite Against Child Marriages (donor: Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs)
projects.description:
The Unite Against Child Marriage Alliance (UACM) programme is implemented by the Dutch SRHR Alliance (Simavi, Amref, Choice, Dance4Life, Rutgers) and Edukans.

The programme uses five strategies to empower girls and fight the practice of child marriage in India and Malawi:

   -  Empowerment of girls
   - Access to formal education
   - Involving local communities
   - Development and improvement of legislation and policies
   - Improved access to SRHR services

These strategies ensure a multi-sector approach to ending child marriage that recognises the importance of empowering girls, mobilising communities and building an enabling environment for legislative change.

Train the Trainers (MDF Training and Consultancy)
Training in Preparing for Education Quality Improvement (University of Amsterdam)

profile_positions.description: Started as program manager for Her Choice Program, a government-funded program aimed to eliminate child marriages in 9 countries in Africa and Asia (2015-2020), and currently working as global country lead for the Right2Grow program, a strategic partnership to end undernutrition and improve access to basic WASH. See: www.right2grow.org
profile_positions.title: Programmamanager & Impact Broker

profile_positions.description:
Edukans is a Dutch non-profit organisation aiming to improve formal and non-formal education Africa, Asia, and Latin-America. The organisation has specific expertise in teaching and learning, comprehensive sexuality education, and vocational training. 

As a country coordinator I am responsibe for: 
- programme development and financial management of the education programmes in Peru and Bolivia (until 2012) and Malawi, Zambia and Ghana. 
- monitoring and evaluation of the programmes and projects in respective countries. 
- capacity development of partner organisations
- Looking for new funding opportunities for the education programmes
- networking with relevant stakeholders both nationally ad internationally. 

Current interesting programmes: 
- Starschool programme in Ghana and Malawi
- Unite Against Child Marriage in Malawi 
- Young People in Charge in Ghana
- Healthy Young People in Malawi
profile_positions.title: Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Edukans is a Dutch non-profit organisation aiming to improve formal and non-formal education Africa, Asia, and Latin-America. The organisation has specific expertise in teaching and learning, comprehensive sexuality education, and vocational training. 

As a Junior Programme Officer (AMID trainee), I have been responsible for: 
- the education programme in Peru
- the initial programme development of the education programme in Bolivia (starting in 2011). 
- the organisation of World Teacher, an exchange project for Dutch teachers and teachers in the South.
profile_positions.title: Junior Programme Officer

profile_positions.description:
NGO Mama Alice is a Dutch non-profit organisation aimed at improving the lives of street children in Ayacucho, Peru. The work of the organisation is based upon 3 pillars: education; well-being and health care; and vocational training. Mama Alice has won the Dutch Transparancy Award in 2006 and 2014, and the Grahame Maher World of Difference Award. 

As a board member I am involved in the strategic discussions and fundraising to increase the results and impact of the work of Mama Alice.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
The Centre for International Development Issues Nijmegen is an interdisciplinary academic institute addressing issues of inequality, poverty, development and empowerment. CIDIN offers education programmes in the field of cultural anthropology and development studies. 

As an assistant for the Professors (Francio Guadeloupe and Tine Davids) for the course "Culture and Development" at faculty of Cultural Anthropology and Development Studies, I was responsible for: 
- facilitating group discussions between the students 
- follow-up and feedback to the weekly group excercises 
- assessment of final paper of group work
- contact with professors and logistical arrangements for the course
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Provincial North South Centre (PNZC) promotes and supports the educational work of organizations, groups and individuals actively working on the North-South relations and sustainable development. This is done by providing services and promoting dialogue and cooperation between the different actors. In addition, the PNZC also organize additional training activities and develops education material. 

As a volunteer I assisted the education expert in the development of different education materials to increase involvement and support for the Millennium Development Goals.

Awashani is a Bolivian NGO offering women working in the mining industry an alternative economic opportunity by training them in the traditional weaving of products designed by a Danish volunteer designer. I have raised funds for the NGO as well as selling the products in Europe.

11.11.11. is a Belgian patform of 60 non-profit organisations that join forces for a world without poverty and injustice. The platform organisation is focused in 3 main tasks: 1) supporting development initatives in the global South, 2) lobby and advocacy at national and international level, and 3) national campaign in November to increase the support and involvement of Belgian citizens.
